acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since 96-hour LC50 for Leiostomus xanthurus (a species of Sciaenidae) is 0.0066 mg/L (EHC 43 (1984)), the substance was classified into Category 1 for acute toxicity.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rabbit dermal LD50 of 410 mg/kg (EHC 43, 1984), the substance was classified into Category 3.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Five rat oral LD50 values documented (95, 132, 126, 96, and 125 mg/kg) (EHC 43, 1984) were statistically analyzed to obtain one representative LD50 value of 102 mg/kg. Based on this value, the substance was classified into Category 3.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It was rated as "Group 2B" by the IARC (IARC S7, 1987) and "R" by the NTP (U.S. NTP, 2005). Based on these ratings, the substance was classified into Category 2.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Its classification for acute toxicity is Category 1, it is not rapidly degradable (BIOWIN 2007), and logPow = 5.41 (SRC 2005). Based on this information, the substance was classified into Category 1 for chronic toxicity.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative results obtained in a dominant lethal study using rats, as well as in vitro chromosomal aberration and Ames tests (ATSDR, 1995), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_solids.rationale: The substance contains chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), which are chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In oral administration tests using rats, though general toxicity to parental animals was not addressed, decreased testicular weight in parental animals, reduced sperm count, decreased litter size, and decreased body weight in the offspring were observed (ATSDR, 1995). Based on these results, the substance was classified into Category 2.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although details in experimental conditions are not provided, irritation of the eyes, nose, and throat were reported in association with the substance (HSDB, 2005). Thus, it was classified into Category 2.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Some workers exposed to high levels of this substance showed signs of skin irritation (ATSDR, 1995). Thus, the substance was classified into Category 2.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: According to ATSDR (1995), dermal sensitization tests done on exposed workers would provide information on the likelihood of developing an allergic response in humans following chlordecone exposure. Such a test was conducted on workers who worked in chlordecone-manufacturing plants, and the development of rashes was noted. Thus, the substance was classified into Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system, liver, adrenal gland)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In an oral administration test with rats, tremors and hypertrophy and histological changes of the liver and adrenals were noted (EHC 43, 1984). These effects were seen at doses that fall under Category 1. Based on these results, the substance was classified into Category 1 (the nervous system, liver, and adrenal gland).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In single administration tests using rats, tremors are reported (ATSDR, 1995). Since this symptom was shown at doses that fall under Category 1 guidance values, the substance was classified into Category 1 (nervous system).
